ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about copyright, fair use, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, different types of intellectual property infringement, and discussed many cases related to these topics!
I developed a great array of skills about critically reading dense legal literature and constructing essays from those works.
IP law! Copyright, patents, trademark
Learned the different elements of IP law: trademarks, patents, copyright. Learned about caselaw in IP and how to read law cases.
Deeper dive into intellectual property
Overall knowledge of various types of IP, including trademark, copyright, patent, and moral rights. Latter half of the course started to apply several of these topics to digital work and issues.
I learned how to read court cases and explored ethical questions and other issues related intellectual property law.
Knowledge of intellectual property law, copyright, trademarks, patents, trade secrets, etc., especially with regard to their applications in technology-based legal events.
Learned about intellectual property and privacy, trademark and patent law, and how to analyze court docs

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the readings every week and that the class only met once per week. Cece was very engaging and willing to get to know each of us. I wish there was more clarity in terms of the structure and expectations of reading responses at the beginning.
The guest speakers were a great way to break up the lectures and I enjoyed how you would do short lectures in the beginning of class then shift to seminar conversation.
Great course! Grading is stressful, but overall great course

Very well put together - the professor was very knowledgable and the material was very interesting. I am not into law or want to necessary be a lawyer but  I still really enjoyed the course. Plus it counts as an HU and a SO elective. The two guest lectures were also very valuable.

This course was my favorite course ever taken at Yale. Professor Xie is amazing and I loved the variety of readings mixed with pop culture applications. My one suggestion is more feedback on the reading responses.
Strengths are that its low courseload, weaknesses are disorganized
The material was cool. The reading responses were pretty long and felt more like short essays. I think also the lectures could've been a bit more grounded in the readings.
I wish we had more debates.
I wish there was a way for us to consider the questions asked in class prior to class, like an overarching question.

Strengths: really fascinating content - it is one of the few classes that I legitimately did all my readings for just cause they were so interesting, Cece also does a great job breaking down complex issues and demystifying intellectual property law; Weaknesses: final project felt like it needed more structure, I ended up doing a paper but would've preferred to do a project had I been given a rubric/more detailed expectations in an outline; the reading responses were also a little much, and I would prefer weekly shorter responses rather than biweekly essay responses, especially since the response mostly just serves as an incentive to do the reading

Strengths: material is very relevant to today, readings can be fun, prof is laidback and chill

Weaknesses: discussions can be lacking

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone interested in intellectual property law!
Yes, this was a great foundation in intellectual property and makes you develop great legal analysis skills which is especially useful for students interested in the law.
YES!!!
Please take the course! Cece is so nice and I learned so much about intellectual property that will actually be useful for my life.
Absolutely. One of the best courses I have taken at Yale. Theres quite a bit of reading, but the class discussions are amazing and the professor is so good.

Absolutely!! You have to take this course if you are interested in intellectual property law or law in general. It was amazing and made me so much more confident in reading court cases and analyzing them.

Absolutely yes! Cece is amazing. This class is such a great look at the law and although IP law can seem boring on the surface level I found it fascinating and way more applicable than I thought it would be. A great pick for anyone interested in law, technology, or a combination of the two.
Yes, as a fifth class!

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is interested in intellectual property. I'm not sure how satisfying it would be for someone who is mainly interested in the tech-side of the class, but it certainly gets there.
Yes, Cece is a blessing.
Absolutely! Professor Xie is brilliant and very kind.
I enjoyed engaging with the legal history of the course subjects. It was interesting to learn about the intersection of the law and modern technology.
Absolutely. As someone who has been thinking about law school for a long time, this class really helped me grasp a legal sector that I had never learned about before.
Highly recommend, useful for all fields
